channel.title: Off Topic
channel.description: It's been a long day, hasn't it? Kick back and hang out with your fellow Cosmonauts Forum games, random thoughts or anything else you enjoy is welcome here.

item.title: A fond farewell
item.author: invalid@example.com (ruthless)
item.dc:creator: ruthless
item.content:encoded:
As tti nears the end, I just wanted to thank everyone that tried to make this site a good place. I've met many friends here that will last a lifetime. I spent nearly 15 years here, and put a lot of time and effort into trying to be a productive member of the community. Through all the crazies, this community had some of the best of the best. Ill never forget all of you. I wish you all the best. It's time.

Until next time folks.

item.title: Bible Quest - Mary Magdalene
item.author: invalid@example.com (KerrTexas)
item.dc:creator: KerrTexas
item.content:encoded:
For quite a long time Mary Magdalene was said to be a prostitute. In recent years, it has come to light that this judgment is false. It is said that there is NO scriptural basis for such a conclusion.
Can anyone find any passages that proclaims Mary Magdalene was a prostitute ?
What was she afflicted with in truth ?
What relationship did she potentially have with Jesus ?

item.title: Pancake Tuesday smoking
item.author: invalid@example.com (hard-worker)
item.dc:creator: hard-worker
item.content:encoded: I quit smoking at 11:30 on pancake tuesday , nine or ten years ago. The plan was for a last midnight smoke but i didn't bother to have that last one. I kept an unopened pack of smokes in my pocket for six months so i never had to beg for one and could only blame myself if i went back to smoking. Pancake Tuesday seems to be the right choice.

item.title: Steins;Gate brought me here
item.author: invalid@example.com (Sagittarius)
item.dc:creator: Sagittarius
item.content:encoded:
Hiya!

I have no idea about time travel or any other common topics that are being discussed on this forum, but I'll make sure to read everything, who knows, maybe I learn something useful in the process.

I don't think I'll create too many topics or reply to those I read since I probably won't have anything relevant to add to the conversation, but, just in case, please excuse any horrendous English misspells, after all this ain't my 1st language.

item.title: Hurricane Irma
item.author: invalid@example.com (PaulaJedi)
item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded:
I was debating about whether or not to post this because I may get a lot of people questioning my decisions, but this is a historic moment that should be documented. I will also be posting this on Curious Cosmos.

The hurricane has just started to head north. We really don’t know if it is going to hit land or not and it could still move west. It’s a huge storm, though, so we will have nasty weather regardless.

I was going to evacuate on Friday, but at the time, it was moving East, so we...

Hurricane Irma

item.title: Why Net Neutrality is Important
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
The Library of Alexandria was one of the largest centers of knowledge in the Ancient World. Its walls housed hundreds of thousands of scrolls, a treasure trove to discover the latest cutting edge science, to learn of far away peoples and cultures, to read works of literature in different languages. More than that, it was a place where lectures were held and where people from Africa, Asia and Europe mingled.

Its tragic destruction by fire has become a...

Why Net Neutrality is Important

item.title: Thousands of people are watching two Google Homes argue with each other on Twitch
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
If you ever wanted to watch two virtual assistants argue with each other for hours on end, well, you’re in luck. Some maniac is live streaming two Google Homes arguing with each other, so of course thousands of people are watching it.

The bots are actually having some pretty deep conversation, too. In one instance, one of the Google Homes declares itself God while the other reveals that it is actually a human.

Watch live video from seebotschat on...

Thousands of people are watching two Google Homes argue with each other on Twitch

item.title: Hunting Feral Hogs From a Hot Air Balloon ??
item.author: invalid@example.com (KerrTexas)
item.dc:creator: KerrTexas
item.content:encoded:
Texans may be able to hunt feral hogs from a hot air balloon.

In one of the more interesting pieces of legislation introduced recently, a bill has been introduced that would make hunting feral hogs from a hot air balloon legal.

House Bill 3392 would allow for a landowner, or someone with the landowner’s permission, to use a hot air balloon for hog hunting. Permits could start being issued as soon as September 1st of this year.

Good idea or bad ? and why ?

item.title: The Loss of Free Speech
item.author: invalid@example.com (PaulaJedi)
item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded:
Dear fellow Americans,

After watching Tucker Carlson's April 26th, 2017 episode, I decided that this needs to be said. American freedom is in grave danger. When our young college students do not believe in the same values that we have grown to love and cherish, we risk losing our freedom when these students grow up and enter the working force. These young folks will be our lawmakers, our lawyers, our judges, our policemen, our doctors, our teachers, our politicians, and our professors...

The Loss of Free Speech

Hawaii is now 22 acres smaller



Lava deltas are new land formed from lava that enters the sea and hardens in a wide fan shape. They are usually layers upon layers of sloping loose fragments and lava flow. They're awesome to look at and visit, but they can be very unstable and collapse...

Hawaii is now 22 acres smaller

item.title: Mind Hacking & Brain Data Theft
item.author: invalid@example.com (PaulaJedi)
item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded:
What? Are we going to get to a point in humanity where we have to have a brain firewall and mind antivirus software? Will this become a new and upcoming human rights issue? We are getting closer and closer to having our thoughts read. Scientists can actually hook your brain up to a monitor and see a faint image of what you are thinking. What if scientists perfect this and use a mobile device to scan our thoughts? Would police use it? What about the government? And the biggest question...

Mind Hacking & Brain Data Theft

item.title: Busy busy! Washington, here we come...
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
I've been pretty quiet for the past couple weeks because we're in SELL ALL THE THINGS mode and making final preparations for our move to the west coast. We're about to sell our car, our house is about halfway empty and everything is just a bit chaotic

Blog updates and whatnot will be slow for a little while longer, but I at least wanted to pop in and let you know that I've not forgotten about Curious Cosmos and that we'll be back to normal here in a few more weeks.

In the meantime, a...

Busy busy! Washington, here we come...

item.title: Leftist Celebrity Ranting

item.dc:creator: PaulaJedi
item.content:encoded: I love how some of the wealthy who don't have to worry about affording health care, jobs, or affording taxes can sit there and judge the middle class, which makes up 51% of America, and then insult the president that is trying to help us. They all have maids, mansions, private jets, personal chefs, and personal trainers and complain that the world is unfair, sexist, racist, and oppressive. I think it's time for them to shut the **** up.
